query: What accuracy gains did your approach achieve on the CRASS benchmark compared to the original Llama-3.2-1B-Instruct model?
How does the BBox-Adapter use sentence-level beam search to guide LLaMA’s generations for counterfactual reasoning tasks like CRASS and IfQA?
How do you mathematically distinguish between intervention-based causal questions and hypothetical “what if” scenarios when evaluating language models?
Describe your training setup and loss formulation for teaching a smaller auxiliary model to rank good and bad answers on counterfactual QA datasets.
If you had to justify using a lightweight sidecar model instead of full fine-tuning for a privacy-sensitive client, how would you explain your design choice?
When improving an LLM’s ability to answer nuanced medical “what would have happened if…” questions, what kind of benchmarking and adaptation strategy would you rely on?
What kind of SpringBoot and React applications have you built at Wells Fargo, and how did the automated testing service fit in?
Can you explain your work on integrating ML models with banking infrastructure for trading desk support and bond pricing?
How did your undergraduate research in speech emotion recognition, text summarization, and fake news detection shape your current research interests?
In what ways did your internships at Amazon and Coding Ninjas complement your NLP-focused academic projects and prepare you for your present role?
If you were asked to design a tool to help neurodivergent users communicate more effectively online, how would your past projects and future study plans influence your design choices?
How have your leadership roles in debating, dance, and IEEE informed the way you would lead a research initiative aimed at combating harmful content on social media?
